metadata.title: CVE-2020-26116 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
http.client in Python 3.x before 3.5.10, 3.6.x before 3.6.12, 3.7.x before3.7.9, and 3.8.x before 3.8.5 allows CRLF injection if the attackercontrols the HTTP request method, as demonstrated by inserting CR and LFcontrol characters in the first argument of HTTPConnection.request.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.9 - 3.9.0-5~20.04
libpython3.9 - 3.9.0-5~20.04
libpython3.9-minimal - 3.9.0-5~20.04
libpython3.9-stdlib - 3.9.0-5~20.04
libpython3.9-testsuite - 3.9.0-5~20.04
python3.9 - 3.9.0-5~20.04
python3.9-examples - 3.9.0-5~20.04
python3.9-minimal - 3.9.0-5~20.04
python3.9-venv - 3.9.0-5~20.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python3.9 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.9.0-5~20.04').
